2 fun things for families

Family-oriented activities for the weekend and beyond

2 fun things for families

7:36 a.m. EST November 5, 2014

Parents with their son and daughter at an amusement park(Photo: Getty Images )

CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

The Frazier History Museum Second Saturday Family Day: Native American History. 829 W. Main St., 11 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturday. Learn about Native Americans through games, storytelling and hands-on objects. Free with admission to the museum. www.fraziermuseum.org.

Carnegie Center Free Family Fun Workshop: Collages of Faces and Places. 201 E. Spring St., New Albany, 10 a.m.-noon Saturday. Bring a magazine to cut up and family photos or copies for each child. For ages 2-10. Children must be accompanied by an adult. Free. Registration is required, (812) 944-7336.

AROUND TOWN: 5 fun things this week

CONCERTS: Top shows to check out

ON STAGE: 5 performances now playing

And lots more to do ...

Children's events

KidZone. Kentucky Science Center, 727 W. Main St., 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Sunday-Thursday; 9:30 a.m.-9 p.m. Friday and Saturday. Included with paid admission to the Kentucky Science Center. (502) 561-6100. www.kysciencecenter.org.

Nature

Bernheim Arboretum and Research Forest. Clermont, Ky. Open daily, 7 a.m.-dusk. Admission is free weekdays and $5 per car weekends. (502) 955-8512. www.bernheim.org.

Blackacre State Nature Preserve and Historic Homestead. 3200 Tucker Station Road. Open weekends and school holidays from dawn until dusk, school days from 3 p.m. until dusk. Admission is free. (502) 266-9802. blackacreconservancy.org.

Jefferson Memorial Forest. 11311 Mitchell Hill Road. Mondays-Saturdays, 8:30 a.m.-4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 10 a.m.-3 p.m. (502) 368-5404. www.memorialforest.com.

Louisville Nature Center. 3745 Illinois Ave. Monday-Saturday, 9 a.m.-4 p.m. Trails are open from dawn until dusk. Admission is free. (502) 458-1328.

Louisville Zoo. 1100 Trevilian Way. Daily, 10 a.m.-5 p.m. General admission: $15.95 for ages 12-59, $11.50 for ages 3-11 and ages 60 and older. Adventure ticket: $25.95 for ages 12-59, $22.95 for ages 3-11 and ages 60 and older. Parking $5. www.louisvillezoo.org.

Yew Dell Gardens. 6220 Old La Grange Road, Crestwood, Monday-Wednesday, Friday and Saturday, 10 a.m.-4 p.m.; Thursday, 10 a.m.-8 p.m. A 33-acre botanical garden. $7 for adults, $5 for seniors, free to members and children ages 12 and under. (502) 241-4788. www.yewdellgardens.org.

Exhibits

Frazier History Museum. 829 W. Main St., 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Monday-Saturday; noon-5 p.m. Sunday. $10.50, $9.50 for military, $8.50 for seniors, $7.50 for college students with ID, $6 for ages 13 and younger, free for ages 4 and younger. Additional cost for special exhibits. (502) 753-5663.

Kentucky Science Center. 727 W. Main St., 9:30 a.m.-5 p.m. Sundays-Thursdays; 9:30 a.m.-9 p.m. Fridays and Saturdays. Exhibit: "Science in Play." Interactive exhibits and a four-story digital wide-screen theater. $18, $14 for ages 2-12. (502) 561-6100. www.kysciencecenter.com.

Muhammad Ali Center. 144 N. Sixth St., 9:30 a.m.-5 p.m. Tuesdays-Saturdays; noon-5 p.m. Sundays. $9; $4 for ages 6-12; free for members and ages 5 and younger. (502) 584-9254. www.alicenter.org.
